events.name: Designed for Innovation
events.description: Designed for Innovation Series  Companies large and small are increasingly turning to innovation to sustain their competiveness. Many try to adopt innovation methods practiced by startups (customer development, MVPs, validated learning, intrapreneurship, etc.) while some even try to annex whole startups through incubation and accelerator programs. Unfortunately, the outcomes have been a mixed bag. Lean startup practices are hard to implement in large organizations, and feisty startups rarely thrive within rigid corporate frameworks. This collaborative meetup series between NUS Enterprise and Design Innovation SG will explore if there is a better way for corporations to tap the entrepreneurship wave. We shall examine how Design Thinking strategies may be adapted to help companies better engage the startup ecosystem. Experienced innovators, designers, strategists and practitioners will be invited to share and discuss what did and did not work in their own innovation journeys. Seminar repeat every 3rd Tuesday of the month.  Please only sign up, if you are coming as the spaces are limited and bring your business card with you.
events.location: The Franklin , 3 Science Park Drive #01-06/09 , Singapore

events.name: Web Design & Development
events.description:
Welcome to the Women Who Code Singapore's 3rd core event this year. Join us for some insights into how to get started with HTML/CSS/Javascript front end web development, the current web development trends & what to watch out for. This is a joint event, brought to you by Women Who Code in collaboration with Viki (a Rakuten Company, https://www.viki.com/) 


Our speakers for the event: Hui Jing Chen (@hj_chen) : A designer and front-end developer who believes HTML and CSS are the foundation of the web. She is also an ardent blogger and co-organizer of the Talk.CSS meetups. She spoke at the 2016 CSS Conf in Singapore on the importance of learning by doing to really master the art of web development. Sher Minn Chong (@piratefsh) : Sher Minn is a front-end web engineer by profession at Viki and also a casual generative artist. She was the co-founder of Rails Girls in KL, a volunteer effort to make computer science accessible to all. Some of her favourite things are web tech, teaching programming, and making weird art with code. Jonathan Wong (</a><a href="https://twitter.com/armchairdude">@armchairdude): Director of Product Management at Viki by day, and moonlights by running Katsu News, an automated news aggregator for Japanese anime and pop culture. In his previous life before Viki, he also worked in engineering, technical sales, developer relations and marketing. He is fascinated by technology and entertainment, and is grateful to be able to work at the intersection of both. Schedule: 6.30 - 7.00 PM: Check-in, Networking, #ApplaudHer 7.00 - 7.15 PM: Updates from Women Who Code & Host Introduction 7.15 - 7.35 PM: Talk by Sher Minn Chong on "What Frontend Web Engineers Don't Tell You", followed by Q&A 7.35 - 8.00 PM: Talk by Hui Jing Chen on "What the web means to me", followed by Q&A 8.00 - 8.25 PM: Talk by Jonathan Wong on "Defining the modern Product Manager", followed by Q&A 8.30 - 8.50 PM: Final remarks & networking This event is intended for women. It is also open to all employees of Viki. Gentlemen interested in attending should bring along a woman friend/colleague with them to the session! All attendees kindly read and abide by the Women Who Code Code of Conduct. 


This event is brought to you in collaboration with:
events.location: Rakuten Crimson House, 138 Market Street, Lvl 32, CapitaGreen, 048946, Singapore

events.name: GovTech Talks: Agile Engineering Practices
events.description: Hey cool people! :)  We have a guest talk by Wendy from GDS@GovTech, followed by an Open Space discussion around the topic of her talk.  Agenda • 18:45 Networking and food • 19:30 Talk "Agile Engineering Practices" • 20:15 Open Space discussion Agile Engineering Practices - Wendy As teams transit from waterfall to agile, it is important to adopt agile engineering practices to handle ever-changing requirements. And because of the focus on user stories delivery, software quality often takes a backseat. In this session, Wendy will share some key agile engineering practices that helps to bake quality into GDS product development, early and continuously. Practices include • Definition of Done • Acceptance criteria • Pair programming • Automated testing AOB: Drivers may park their cars at Galaxis or Fusionopolis. Sandcrawler does not provide parking for visitors.

events.name: Hello Doctor! AI and Healthcare
events.description:
Guest Speakers Rohit Kumar Pandey, founder and CEO of SigTuple  


"When we asked dozens of venture capitalists where they see the most potential for applied artificial intelligence, they unanimously agreed on health care. Technology has already been used to incrementally improve patient medical records, care delivery, diagnostic accuracy, and drug development, but with AI we could achieve exponential breakthroughs."

events.name: March Ruby Meetup
events.description:
Hi fellow Rubyists!  Come join us for our March 2017 Ruby meetup at RingMD, 72 Club St, Singapore 069471. -------------- Programme 1. "Store Wearable Data with ElasticSearch and Ruby" ~ Vu Minh Tan from RingMD 2.  "Daily Kata" ~ Daniel from Tinkerbox 4. Announcements   - This is a 5 to 10-minute session, during which anyone can stand up and share something interesting! -------------- Interested to give a talk at future meetups? You could share about your startup technology stack, your new RubyGem, your opinions on best practices, or projects you discovered or are working on. And we are especially friendly towards beginners! See you all soon! --------------  Thank you Sponsors! Venue and Food Sponsor  Video Recording Many thanks to @engineersftw for video coverage!

events.name: An Introduction to Scala JS
events.description: This talk will introduce Scala.js: what it is, how it works, and why you may want to use it. We will explore how you can liberate your investment in Scala code and expertise, using it to build websites or Chrome plugins or Node.js apps, unshackled by its traditional home in back-end JVM services Speaker Bio: Haoyi is a software engineer, previously working at Dropbox, now working on a developer tools startup. He is an active contributor to the open-source Scala ecosystem.
events.location: ThoughtWorks , 18 cross street #11-08 China Sq Central (S)048423, Singapore

events.name: March2017 Meetup: "Have I been pwned?" and "Your Arsenal to bypass restrictions"
events.description: We have 2 speakers lined up for our March 2017 meetup! Topic A: Have I been pwned? "Have I been pwned?" allows you to search across multiple data breaches to see if your email addresses or aliases has been compromised by Duowan, Taobao, Tianya, etc Maltego is a link analysis application of technical infrastructure and/or social media networks from disparate sources of Open Source INTelligence (OSINT). Maltego is listed on the Top 10 Security Tools for Kali Linux by Network World and Top 125 Network Security Tools by the Nmap Project. The integration of "Have I been pwned?" with Maltego presents these breaches in an easy to understand graph format that can be enriched with other sources of data. Speaker: Christian HeinrichChristian Heinrich has presented at the OWASP Conferences in Australia, Europe and USA and OWASP Chapters in the Netherlands, London and Sydney and Melbourne, Australia, ToorCon (USA), Shmoocon (USA), BlackHat (Asia and USA), SecTor (Canada), CONFidence (Europe), Hack In The Box (Europe), SyScan (Singapore), B-Sides (Australia), RUXCON (Australia), and AusCERT (Australia) cmlh has a Public Profile on LinkedIn at http://www.linkedin.com/in/ChristianHeinrich Topic B: Your Arsenal to bypass restrictions based on IP counters PyMultiTor tool – Many mitigation devices (FW, WAF, Anti-DoS) are detecting attacks based on certain IP address that sends many requests. The tools showcases that it’s not enough to have such protection. It is unique because it is easily integrated in any attacking tool (written in python programming language). Speaker: Tomer Zait Tomer Zait, from F5 Labs (part of F5 Network), has worked in a range of professions in the security industry (W.A.F Integrator, Penetration Tester, Application Security Engineer, Security Researcher, Etc.). During this time he developed open source projects (most of them are security tools). Tomer is a 3 Times Winner of the Israeli Cyber Challenge (CTF). His projects include: x64dbgpy; PyMultitor; SubDomain-Analyzer; AutoBrowser; phantom-requests.
events.location: Akamai Singapore office, 1 Raffles Place, #16-61, One Raffles Place Tower 2, Singapore 048616
